content:
Hi all, not sure if this is the right place for this question,

I'm running into a bug with the simd_bitmask intrinsic on MIPS: https://github.com/rust-lang/stdsimd/pull/99/checks?check_run_id=2415305187

This intrinsic is effectively integer truncation followed by a bitcast from <i1 x N> into a single integer. On MIPS it gets the bit order wrong (reversed). Does anyone think this is perhaps correct? Or a bug in LLVM?
